conclusion: To solve the problem, analyze the graph to determine when the particle is farthest from its starting point.

The image shows a graph of velocity (v) against time (t) for a particle. The particle starts from rest at time t = 0, with a velocity that increases linearly until it reaches a maximum at t = 10 s. It then decreases back to zero at t = 20 s, and changes direction again.

The particle begins at rest and moves with a velocity that increases linearly until t = 10 s. At t = 10 s, the velocity reaches its maximum, indicating the particle is moving the fastest at this point.
After t = 10 s, the velocity decreases back to zero at t = 20 s. Since the velocity is greatest at t = 10 s, this is when the particle is farthest from its starting point in terms of displacement.
The particle is moving away from the starting point at t = 10 s, reaching its maximum displacement.
